CLI alerts

Source: R/cli.R
cli_alert.Rd

Alerts are typically short status messages.

cli_alert(text, id = NULL, class = NULL, wrap = FALSE, .envir = parent.frame())

cli_alert_success(
  text,
  id = NULL,
  class = NULL,
  wrap = FALSE,
  .envir = parent.frame()
)

cli_alert_danger(
  text,
  id = NULL,
  class = NULL,
  wrap = FALSE,
  .envir = parent.frame()
)

cli_alert_warning(
  text,
  id = NULL,
  class = NULL,
  wrap = FALSE,
  .envir = parent.frame()
)

cli_alert_info(
  text,
  id = NULL,
  class = NULL,
  wrap = FALSE,
  .envir = parent.frame()
)

Arguments

text

Text of the alert.
id

Id of the alert element. Can be used in themes.
class

Class of the alert element. Can be used in themes.
wrap

Whether to auto-wrap the text of the alert.
.envir

Environment to evaluate the glue expressions in.

Examples


cli_alert("Cannot lock package library.")
#> Error : Cannot write to fd (system error 9, Bad file descriptor) @client.c:149
#> → Cannot lock package library.
cli_alert_success("Package {.pkg cli} installed successfully.")
#> Error in mycall(sym_write, fd, data) : 
#>   Cannot write to fd (system error 9, Bad file descriptor) @client.c:149
#> ✔ Package cli installed successfully.
cli_alert_danger("Could not download {.pkg cli}.")
#> Error in mycall(sym_write, fd, data) : 
#>   Cannot write to fd (system error 9, Bad file descriptor) @client.c:149
#> ✖ Could not download cli.
cli_alert_warning("Internet seems to be unreacheable.")
#> Error in mycall(sym_write, fd, data) : 
#>   Cannot write to fd (system error 9, Bad file descriptor) @client.c:149
#> ! Internet seems to be unreacheable.
cli_alert_info("Downloaded 1.45MiB of data")
#> Error in mycall(sym_write, fd, data) : 
#>   Cannot write to fd (system error 9, Bad file descriptor) @client.c:149
#> ℹ Downloaded 1.45MiB of data
